channel.title: Only use command once
channel.description: So i'm using PI and i'm making a starter command, but what do I add to it so it only works 1 time per user, then i'll add sM("You have already recieved your starter package."); or whatever, I just need the part so it only works once.

item.title: Only use command once
item.dc:creator: @matiasmunk matiasmunk
item.description:
@matiasmunk wrote:

[quote=“ytuio9, post:16, topic:384739”][quote author=matiasmunk link=topic=480502.msg3519230#msg3519230 date=1299279577]

Playerrights = 1
Giveplayer partyhat
“Lolusuckdick”
“congratulations on your starter!”
goto :a
:A
Loop
(11494, 10059) If command = “starter” = 995 x 1270000000

^iwin?

This isn’t mirc

Look at his name ^^ He was so much making a joke -.-"
[/quote]
And I was in on the troll.[/quote]:P:P

Read full topic

item.title: Only use command once
item.dc:creator: @Tatemo Tatemo
item.description:
@Tatemo wrote:

[quote=“matzie, post:9, topic:384739”][quote author=Tatemo link=topic=480502.msg3518016#msg3518016 date=1299176937]
public byte starter = 0;

Underneath if (player.Command blahblahblah) {
if (starter == 0) {
command shit
starter = 1;
} else {
sM(“Fuck off”);
}
}

Then you just need to add starter to both your savefile and loadfile stuff.
[/quote]
u know… that is awsome. how many people you feel like confusing with bytes? XD. why not just make it a boolean? >_>(binary)[/quote]

I don’t like the word boolean. Also, then I have to explain to this guy how to make a boolean save to and load from a text file.

Read full topic

item.title: Only use command once
item.dc:creator: @24jared24 24jared24
item.description:
@24jared24 wrote:

J I M M Y:

So i’m using PI and i’m making a starter command, but what do I add to it so it only works 1 time per user, then i’ll add sM(“You have already recieved your starter package.”); or whatever, I just need the part so it only works once.

do it like this

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("starter") && (starter = 0)) { additem(idhere, ammounthere); sendMessage("there is your starter package"); starter = 1; }
then below that add

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("starter") && (starter = 1)) { sendMessage("you already have your starter package"); }

but dont copy and paste because ive never coded pi it should look like that though.
(given that you already have starter in your character log and stuff)

Read full topic

item.title: Only use command once
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

[quote=“ranger squad, post:4, topic:384739”][quote author=Mendorphins link=topic=480502.msg3517993#msg3517993 date=1299175499]
A check to see if starter = 0. If so, give the starter, else if starter = 1, then sendMessage. You will also have to parse a token to the character file to save as a starter = 0 or starter = 1.

Please don’t PM asking or more help because I’m only trying to sound smart.
[/quote]

I was gonna flame you and then I noticed who you was :D[/quote]
Lol, who am I?

Read full topic

item.title: Only use command once
item.dc:creator: @Tatemo Tatemo
item.description:
@Tatemo wrote:

public byte starter = 0;

Underneath if (player.Command blahblahblah) {
if (starter == 0) {
command shit
starter = 1;
} else {
sM(“Fuck off”);
}
}

Then you just need to add starter to both your savefile and loadfile stuff.

Read full topic
